isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 3.5: CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - SELF TEST INPUT SWITCH AND ENGINE WARNING LIGHT - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcsubproc.title: SELF TEST INPUT (STI) SWITCH
svcsubproc.para:
If depressing the STI switch with key on and engine off does not cause the OCC tests to run (if no faults are detected code 111 should flash), perform Testing The STI Circuit ( Figure 3.159
).

svcsubproc.title: ENGINE WARNING LIGHT (EWL)

step1.para: Before troubleshooting, make sure that the batteries are fully charged! Check battery connections and grounds for clean, tight connections free of damage. Voltage tests will give misleading results if the batteries are not fully charged.

Before troubleshooting, inspect circuit connectors for pushed back, loose, or damaged (spread or bent) terminals, or wires with cut strands, etc. Wires and connections must be free of damage or corrosion. When some connectors corrode, a light white residue will be present that must be removed.
Before troubleshooting, inspect suspect circuit grounds for clean, tight connections free of damage.
